name: Easy No-Bake Butterfinger® and Peanut Butter Pretzel Bars
description: With milk chocolate morsels, pretzels, peanut butter and Nestlé® Butterfinger® candy pieces, these no-bake bars are the perfect sweet and salty treat both kids and adults can enjoy!
recipeIngredient: 1 ¾ cups NESTLE® TOLL HOUSE® Milk Chocolate Morsels, divided
37 pieces NESTLE® BUTTERFINGER® Bites Candy, coarsely chopped
1 cup small pretzel twists, broken into 1/2-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Line 13 x 9-inch baking pan with foil leaving an overhang on two sides.   Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray.

Heat marshmallows, butter and salt in large, heavy-duty saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, for 5 to 10 minutes, until smooth.   Remove from heat.  Add 1 cup morsels and peanut butter; stir until melted.

Working quickly, stir in cereal, chopped Butterfinger and pretzels.  Stir in remaining 3/4 cup morsels.  Spread mixture into prepared baking pan with greased spatula, pressing down lightly.  Cool for 2 hours or until set.  Lift from pan; remove foil.  Cut into bars with serrated knife.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Easy No-Bake Butterfinger® and Peanut Butter Pretzel Bars

review.reviewBody: This recipe definitely needs TWEEKED!!! The finished product definitely does not look like the picture. Made this for a bake sale and had to turn up empty handed because of the appearance.

This was delicious. I did make a couple of changes. I didn't have butterfingers but I remembered they were made with Captain Crunch Cereal so I added Capt. Crunch instead of the cereal and candy bars. I also bumped up the peanut butter to 1/2 cup and the pretzels up to 2 cups (since I was taking out the Chex) to make it more nutritious and sent them with my hubby on an eight day bike ride. All his friends thought I was wonderful!

This is really good but I made quite a few changes so I’m not sure if I’m really reviewing what this recipe would normally taste like. However, I used no Chex; I doubled the pretzels and added 2 cups crisp rice cereal (Rice Krispies). Instead of butterfingers, I used about 1/2 cup of Skor bits I had. I increased peanut butter to 1/2 cup of crunchy natural, unsweetened peanut butter. I used margarine instead of butter. I used coloured mini marshmallows instead of plain. I only used the melted 1 cup of chocolate chips, and didn’t add the remaining 3/4 cup as chunks. I am happy with every change I made. The only thing I’d like to try different is what it would taste like using the right kind cereal. I love that it’s not as sweet as the original recipe might have made it. And I love the salty-sweet combo so much! I might even add chopped peanuts if I make it again. It was a great way to use up some items in my pantry that had been there too long.
